item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeThe coronavirus has affected most Americans, but NPR's latest poll shows Black, Latino and Native American...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeThe coronavirus has affected most Americans, but NPR's latest poll shows Black, Latino and Native American households are hardest hit by the financial impact of the crisis.

npr.org

How The Pandemic Is Widening The Racial Wealth Gap

The coronavirus has affected most Americans, but NPR's latest poll shows Black, Latino and Native American households are hardest hit by the financial impact of the crisis.The coronavirus has affected most Americans, but NPR's latest poll shows Black, Latino and Native American households are hardest hit by the financial impact of the crisis.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeThe Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeThe Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or a protective hairstyle that is commonly or historically associated with race."

coloradosun.com

Colorado’s hair discrimination law — the CROWN Act — goes into effect

The Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or a protective hairstyle that is commonly or historically associated with race."The Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or a protective hairstyle that is commonly or historically associated with race."

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeAccording to data reported to the CDC, 121 children died from COVID-19 between February and July of this...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeAccording to data reported to the CDC, 121 children died from COVID-19 between February and July of this year. And 78% of the children who died were Hispanic, Black or Native American.

npr.org

The Majority Of Children Who Die From COVID-19 Are Children Of Color

According to data reported to the CDC, 121 children died from COVID-19 between February and July of this year. And 78% of the children who died were Hispanic, Black or Native American.According to data reported to the CDC, 121 children died from COVID-19 between February and July of this year. And 78% of the children who died were Hispanic, Black or Native American.

item.title: Apply for additional food aid by Sept 23.
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social Justice

Apply for additional food aid by Sept 23.

The families of more than 200,000 Colorado children have until Sept. 23 to apply for Pandemic EBT benefits of $279 per child.

co.chalkbeat.org

Colorado families are leaving $58 million in federal food aid on the table. Time is running out to apply.

The families of more than 200,000 Colorado children have until Sept. 23 to apply for Pandemic EBT benefits of $279 per child.The families of more than 200,000 Colorado children have until Sept. 23 to apply for Pandemic EBT benefits of $279 per child.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Alliance for Street Health ResponseOne city, two worlds. Denver will go from sweltering heat with a...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Alliance for Street Health Response

One city, two worlds. Denver will go from sweltering heat with a high of 93 degrees on Monday to 34 degrees and snowing on Tuesday. This is why, with unpredicta...ble weather changes like this, taking survival gear from unhoused folks and trashing it is dehumanizing violence. Not only is it environmentally wasteful and costly to taxpayers, but it condemns folks on the street to suffering and possibly death. Folks can’t take their tents and sleeping bags into shelters either, and surely in the middle of a global pandemic, we might understand why folks would rather be outside than crammed in shelters.

Denver Homeless Out Loud is collecting sleeping bags, tents, tarps, and other survival gear at 2260 California until 5pm today and will distribute to folks in the area (contact info@denverhomelessoutloud.org for questions). DASHR will be supporting folks in the Cap Hill area tomorrow by handing out hand warmers, socks, and supporting unhoused folks with our street medics. We will also be coordinating with the STAR van for crises that are beyond our street team. Contact us to get involved or to find ways to support these efforts at dashrorg@gmail.com or by messaging this page.

See More

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeWe Are North DenverDid you know the width of #NavajoNation is approximately 600 miles? That is why we are...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeWe Are North Denver

Did you know the width of #NavajoNation is approximately 600 miles? That is why we are having a 600 mile "Move for the Nation" virtual race to raise funds to he...lp the Navajo Nation through the upcoming winter months.

Looking for compassionate runners walkers, swimmers, joggers, etc. Please tag them here and let them know of our fundraiser. If you don't walk or run, you can do 600 of something and raise money for our mission. We have a fundraising goal of $10,000. Please help us get there by registering today and spreading the word to all the compassionate people in your life.

https://runsignup.com/Race/CO/Anywhere/MovefortheNation (link in bio)

#CompassionateColorado
#compassionunited
#runforcompassion
#MoveforetheNation

See More

item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeGraduate School of Social Work, University of Denver

If words fail you right now, action should not. Demand that the police officers are held accountable for the shooting of #JacobBlake. Act Now.

Kenosha District ...Attorney: 262-653-2400, Michael.Graveley@da.wi.gov
Kenosha Mayor and City Administrator: 262-653-4000, mayor@kenosha.org, cityadministrator@kenosha.org
Wisconsin DOJ: 608-266-1221

#BlackLivesMatter

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeBucket List Community Cafe Northside DenverOur birthday fundraiser for Bienvenidos Food Bank is going great. ...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeBucket List Community Cafe Northside Denver

Our birthday fundraiser for Bienvenidos Food Bank is going great. Thanks Kathleen, Macky, Sharman and Erika for donating. Bienvenidos gives away enough food f...or 300,000 meals a year. They purchase food from farms and save 180,000 pounds of food from groceries that would have been thrown away. This pandemic has hit people hard and non-profits like Beinvenidos are stepping up. Please donate on the link below and share!

https://www.coloradogives.org/bucketlistcommunitycafe

Sunnyside United Neighbors, Inc
BRUN - Berkeley Regis United Neighbors
Tenn Street Coffee & Books
Bienvenidos Food Bank
North Denver for Social Justice: Organizers
North Denver for Social Justice
Highland United Neighbors, Inc. (HUNI)
Chaffee Park Registered Neighborhood Organization - CPRNO
RiNo, River North Art District

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ DenverPolicing has always been beyond reform. Policing in this country...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Policing has always been beyond reform. Policing in this country is rotten at the roots. The system must be dug up in its entirety, and a new system that values... human life must replace the violence and corruptness of policing.
#JacobBlake #blacklivesmatter

***
[ID: an instagram post on a yellow background from Son of Baldwin that reads “If you can shoot an unarmed Black person down in broad daylight, during a pandemic, with the cameras rolling, in a time of protest, when the whole world is specifically watching you to see if it’s true what Black people have been saying about your murderous rampage—that means that you will stop at nothing to murder Black people, justifying any and every response from the rebellion.”]

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeThere are currently five government investigations into the Aurora Police Department and Elijah McClain’s...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeThere are currently five government investigations into the Aurora Police Department and Elijah McClain’s death in August 2019, all sparked by national uproar over police tactics and racial inequality.

cpr.org

The Adams County Coroner Met With Aurora Police Before Elijah McClain’s Cause Of Death Was Determined

There are currently five government investigations into the Aurora Police Department and Elijah McClain’s death in August 2019, all sparked by national uproar over police tactics and racial inequality.There are currently five government investigations into the Aurora Police Department and Elijah McClain’s death in August 2019, all sparked by national uproar over police tactics and racial inequality.
